annotation: Correction: Hermelito Go, should have final glottal stop

language: East Sumbanese, Umbu Ratu Nggai dialect
annotation: M: pawànji La: pawànc Le: pawònju
to spit anything out of the mouth, but not spittle
Spray out from the mouth (e.g. chewed-up medicinal leaves or water) (Bgs)

language: Kadazan Dusun of Taginambur, Kota Belud, Sabah, Malaysia

annotation: Saliva, spittle, to spit (Tgr); salive, crachat, cracher (Jnu)
2. To spit s.t out aft putting it in one's mouth
spit; seems likely that this is a loan from NWSols languages
spit; with metathesis of non-initial consonants
SA: L removed because not clear why is should be a Javanese loan
Rejeter de la bouche en soufflant; cracher (Btn)
'to spit, to reject something like food'
